subject: Critical Thinking
title: Consider the Opposite: The Simplest Debiasing Trick
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Consider the Opposite: The Simplest Debiasing Trick.

hook.text: The single most effective debiasing technique takes five seconds: 'What if the opposite were true?'

buildup.text: Lord, Lepper & Preston (1984) showed that simply asking people to consider the opposing view reduced bias significantly.

discovery.text: It works because most biases come from one-sided thinking â€” we search for confirming evidence and stop.

twist.text: You don't have to believe the opposite. Just imagining it activates different evidence in your memory.

climax.text: Intelligence agencies use this formally: 'Red Team' analysis forces analysts to argue the opposing case.

punchline.text: The cure for bias is a question, not an answer.

quiz.question: What is the simplest proven technique for reducing cognitive bias?
options: Asking 'What if the opposite were true?'
